attributes.comment:
My biggest concern is with the form I600A, which gains a person/couple the
approval to adopt. This approval, once granted, is only good for 18 months and
most adoptions take longer than 18 months. So that means that the form must
be submitted again with new fingerprints. Can this 18 months be extended to 24-
30 months? Most international adoptions take about 24 months to complete, so a
minimum of 24 months is needed. By doing this, it would cut down on the
amount of processing needed to be done at each USCIS location, and it seems
that many of these locations already have a backlog, so reducing workload would
be a good thing. And it would also be a good thing for adoptive parents, as it
would be one less form, in the mountain of paperwork required for adoption, that
they need to worry about expiring.

thank you for considering
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Sheryl Prince
